question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What position did Antoni Xuclà Bas hold in 2000?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Unwavering Voice of Democracy: Antoni Xuclà Bas, a Pillar of the Cortes Españolas

In the tumultuous landscape of post-Civil War Spain, a beacon of hope emerged in the form of Antoni Xuclà Bas, a stalwart politician who dedicated his life to upholding the principles of democracy. As a procurador en Cortes, Xuclà Bas played a pivotal role in shaping the country's legislative landscape, leaving an indelible mark on the Cortes Españolas, the Spanish parliament, from 1943 to 1977. Born in 1913, Xuclà Bas grew up in a Spain torn apart by political and social unrest. The devastating consequences of the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939) had left the country reeling, and the subsequent dictatorship of General Francisco Franco had stifled democratic voices. Yet, Xuclà Bas remained resolute in his commitment to democratic ideals, undeterred by the oppressive regime. In 1943, Xuclà Bas took his first step into the political arena, becoming a procurador en Cortes, a member of the Cortes Españolas. This esteemed position granted him a platform to advocate for the rights of the Spanish people, and he seized it with unwavering determination. As a procurador, Xuclà Bas was tasked with representing the interests of his constituents, working tirelessly to promote social justice, economic development, and political reform. One of Xuclà Bas's most significant contributions during this period was his unwavering support for the Spanish economy. As the country struggled to rebuild in the aftermath of the Civil War, Xuclà Bas championed policies aimed at stimulating growth, creating jobs, and improving living standards. His efforts were instrumental in shaping the country's economic landscape, paving the way for Spain's eventual transition to a modern, industrialized nation. Xuclà Bas's commitment to democracy was further demonstrated through his vocal opposition to Franco's authoritarian regime. Despite the risks, he consistently spoke out against human rights abuses, advocating for greater freedoms and protections for the Spanish people. His courageous stance earned him the respect and admiration of his peers, as well as the ire of the Franco regime. Throughout his tenure as a procurador en Cortes, Xuclà Bas worked closely with other like-minded politicians, forming alliances and coalitions to push for democratic reforms.
content.source_2: In the year 2025, the esteemed institution of ETH Zürich, one of the world's premier science and technology universities, was on the cusp of a new era. After a rigorous selection process, the board of directors announced that Antoni Xuclà Bas, a renowned Spanish politician and visionary, would take the reins as the new Head of ETH Zürich. As Bas stepped into his new role, he was met with a mix of excitement and skepticism. Some wondered how a politician, no matter how accomplished, could lead an institution steeped in academic tradition. But Bas was undaunted, bringing with him a unique blend of political acumen and passion for innovation. Over the next 16 years, Bas proved to be a transformative leader, guiding ETH Zürich through a period of unprecedented growth and change. He championed interdisciplinary research, fostering collaborations between scientists, engineers, and entrepreneurs to tackle the world's most pressing challenges. Under his leadership, the university became a hotbed of innovation, attracting top talent from around the globe. As the years passed, Bas's vision for ETH Zürich began to take shape. He oversaw the development of cutting-edge facilities, including state-of-the-art labs, incubators, and accelerators. He also launched initiatives to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion, ensuring that the university's doors were open to students and faculty from all backgrounds. One of Bas's most significant achievements was his role in shaping the university's response to the climate crisis. He convened international conferences, bringing together experts from academia, industry, and government to develop sustainable solutions. ETH Zürich became a hub for climate research, with Bas at the forefront of efforts to develop clean energy, mitigate the effects of climate change, and promote environmental stewardship. As the years went by, Bas's leadership was marked by a series of milestones. In 2030, ETH Zürich launched its first satellite into orbit, a testament to the university's growing presence in space exploration. In 2035, the university celebrated the opening of its new campus, a sustainable, futuristic complex that embodied Bas's vision for the future. Through it all, Bas remained committed to his core values: innovation, collaboration, and social responsibility. He inspired a new generation of leaders, entrepreneurs, and change-makers, who went on to make their mark on the world.
